data.text:
Image alignment is used to position images at various locations (top, bottom, right, left, middle) on your web pages. The tag’s align attribute is used to align images, making it easier to create visually appealing layouts. In this article, we will explore different methods to align images using the align attribute and provide examples for each alignment option. Syntax To align an image using the align attribute, the syntax is as follows: Attribute Values left: Aligns the image to the left. right: Aligns the image to the right. middle: Aligns the image to the middle. top: Aligns the image to the top. bottom: Aligns the image to the bottom. Method 1: Left Alignment of the Image To align the image to the left use attribute value as “left”. Syntax Example : In this example The align=”left” attribute in the tag aligns the image to the left side of the page, allowing text to flow around it. HTML Left Alignment of Image
